text: Moïse Katumbi Chapwe (; born 28 December 1964) is a Congolese politician who served as Governor of Katanga Province from 2007 to 2015. He was one of the contenders to succeeded by Joseph Kabila in the run up to the 2018 election but he was barred from returning and entering the country to file in his nomination for the presidency.https://www.washingtontimes.com/sponsored/moise-katumbi-devil-congo/ Moise Katumbi, the Devil the Democratic Republic of Congo Doesn't Want - Washington Timeshttps://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/08/opposition-candidate-moise-katumbi-blocked-entering-drc-180803133022644.html | Opposition leader Moise Katumbi blocked from entering DRChttps://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2018/07/31/dr-congo-multi-millionaire-moise-katumbi-seeks-to-return-home-to-contest-elections/ DR Congo Multi-Millionaire Moise Katumbi Seeks To Return Home To Contest Elections In December 2021, Moïse Katumbi officially launched his political party in view of the 2023 presidential election.https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1283292/politique/rdc-ni-allie-ni-opposant-moise-katumbi-a-du-mal-a-choisir-son-camp/ POLITIQUE RDC : ni allié ni opposant, Moïse Katumbi a du mal à choisir son camp - Jeune Afrique == References == Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Governors Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo politicians
title: Moise Katumbi
